memories.name: Team Leadership Goals
memories.episode_body: Focus on building team automation capabilities. Isabel is strong on infrastructure, James needs more mentoring on Kubernetes. Planning to standardize deployment processes across all services.

memories.name: Henry Brooks - DevOps Lead
memories.episode_body: Henry Brooks is DevOps Lead at TechFlow Solutions, leading the DevOps Team. Expert in Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD automation, cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP), and reliability engineering. 8 years DevOps experience. Manages Isabel Gomez and James Park.

memories.name: Kubernetes Cluster Setup
memories.episode_body: Production cluster runs on GKE (Google Kubernetes Engine) with 3 node pools: system (cluster services), application (workloads), data (stateful services). Auto-scaling enabled, min 3 nodes per pool. Monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana. Alerts configured for high CPU, memory, pod failures.

memories.name: CI/CD Pipeline Architecture
memories.episode_body: Using GitHub Actions for CI/CD. Pipeline stages: 1) Lint and format check, 2) Run tests, 3) Build Docker image, 4) Push to registry, 5) Deploy to staging, 6) Run E2E tests, 7) Deploy to production (manual approval). Deployment uses ArgoCD for GitOps workflow.

memories.name: Payment Service Deployment Requirements
memories.episode_body: Payment service needs: PostgreSQL database, Redis cache, Kafka connection, secrets (Stripe API key). Kubernetes deployment: 3 replicas, resource limits 2GB RAM/1 CPU, liveness/readiness probes on /health endpoint. Uses HPA to scale 2-10 replicas based on CPU >70%.

memories.name: Payment Migration DevOps Support
memories.episode_body: DevOps support for payment migration scheduled for January 28, 2026. On track with no blockers. Kubernetes setup includes: 3 node pools (system, app, data) with auto-scaling enabled (2-10 replicas), monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana, CI/CD pipeline using ArgoCD, blue-green deployment strategy. Staging environment complete. Production environment ready for deployment. Rollback plan documented and tested.

memories.name: Redis Infrastructure
memories.episode_body: Redis is deployed as a StatefulSet in Kubernetes with persistent volumes. Current configuration: 8GB memory limit, 4GB reserved. Redis is a single point of failure for services using distributed locks and caching. Monitoring: alerts on memory usage >80%, pod restarts, connection errors. Common issue: OOM (out of memory) kills when memory limit is too low.
